February 1, 1923
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I am enclosing for your information
copies of correspondence enc. 1; enc. 2; enc. 3 received by Dwight P.
Robinson and Company from their representatives
in Brazil with reference to the yellow fever situ-
ation in the region about Ceara. There continue
to be cases reported from this region. One man,
Buchler, employed by Dwight P. Robinson and
Company died from yellow fever on January 26.

Doctor Walcott has arrived, and will
stay in New York until Doctor White comes from
Mexico. We expect Doctor White in about a week.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Florence M. Read Doctor H. R. Carter
Assistant Surgeon General
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
